REVIEW: Dec 24 2007 	A great choice whether you're there for business or for romance	It may sound a bit strange, but I think it's true. Perfect for business and for romance too (not so for singles, partiers, families with kids and so on).Elegant, quiet, perfectly located in a very good part of town ... I think the Omni really has it all. It's obsviously not an inexpensive choice, but their rates are very reasonable for what you get.The lobby is beautiful and the rooms extremely clean, quite large and very comfortable, with incredible beds and bathrooms wonderfully appointed with marble and green and black granite. Room service was very good and front desk staff was efficient.One of the definite pluses of the hotel is the express check-out. So efficient, as you bypass the usual check-out procedures (unless you disagree with the price to pay). You gave them your credit card when checking-in, so finding your final bill in an envelope at your door room the final morning and simply leaving is always a great thing.The restaurant is average and quite overpriced, but I guess this is somewhat usual in this kind of properties. It was definitely what I like the least. You don't need to pay such prices for breakfast or dinner, especially considering you will find plenty of fantastic places to eat at reasonable prices in nearby North Beach and all over the city.The location is the very best I could personally ask for. I understand that those who visit San Francisco for the first time usually prefer to stay in Union Square (which, by the way, is within walking distance) or in Fisherman's Wharf (which I would never recommend), but, for me, the area around the Omni is the very best. for the following reasons:a) The area is very nice and you're within walking distance to places such as Union Square, North Beach, Chinatown, the Embarcadero, the cable car turntable, and so on.b) It is very quiet, as it is located at the edge of the financial district.So, when I have enough budget for it, the Omni is, for all those reasons and more, my personal choice in San Francisco, my very favourite city.

Dec 17 2007 	Great hotel for an anniversary stay	My husband and I decided to splurge on a nice hotel for our third wedding anniversary. We live only an hour from San Francisco, but wanted to eat a nice dinner there, plus we had tickets for a football game the next afternoon. We got a decent price for a one-night stay, and we got more than our money's worth at this very luxurious hotel! The staff was incredibly friendly, the standard room was very comfortable, and it's an overall beautiful place. I liked the complimentary bath robes, and the toiletries in the bathroom smelled wonderful! The bar/lounge is nice, although the bartender on shift at the time was a little stiff. Check-in was quick, although we checked in online ahead of time and they didn't have our folio ready. Loved the warm apple cider and cookies they had available for guests downstairs! The hotel is in a great location near Union Square, although we didn't do any sight-seeing since we just had dinner and the football game in mind for our stay. I can't speak to the restaurant (we had breakfast at Starbucks a couple of blocks away) or the business traveler amenities, but I'm sure they're quite nice.NOTE: Parking is a MAJOR expense at San Francisco hotels, and this one is no exception! We did our homework and found a 24-hour city lot one block up the street to park our car - St. George's Square lot, I believe. We only paid $7 for the night (although I think the cashier made an error...it still would have been cheaper than the $45 the hotel would have charged us for valet).

Dec 13 2007 	Hotel stay part was great marred by concierge and steakhouse	We were there the day after Thanksgiving. It had a nice upscale feel for a reasonable rate of about $160 for a regular room (Thanksgiving weekend). Perfect if you want something nice that is kid friendly. Our family had a room, and the other family we were traveling with had 2 rooms with connecting doors. Both of our families have children ages 5 to 11. We loved the pretty hotel, decked out for the holidays. We loved its proximity to Chinatown (5 mins walk), and around 10 min walk to Union Square. It was a block away from a Walgreens and McDonalds, which is convenient if you have kids. The children loved their Omni backpacks and the complimentary milk and cookies. The staff is nice and attentive, they clean the room 2x/day. Downside is the concierge. They gave wrong information on restaurants twice - once they gave the wrong address to a restaurant they recommended at the Fisherman's Wharf. Another time they assured (and refused to double check) that a restaurant will be open for Thanksgiving dinner. When we got there, the restaurant was closed. They also were not aware of a fun pack that the Omni loans to kids that contains games and activities and such.For the restaurant in the hotel, Bob's Steakhouse... It was "ok". One thing a steak purist would frown on is that the steak comes to you with a humongous giant single carrot right in the middle of the plate as if it is the main dish. The steak and the potatoes are to its left and right. Also, the carrot was dripping in glaze that contaminated our steak. When we inquired about this, they said that it is a Bob's Steakhouse signature (putting the carrot in the middle), but you can always ask to put it on the side.

Dec 9 2007 	Great Hotel in a Great City	My partner and I stayed at the Omni for a long weekend, we are former residents of San Francisco and are well acquainted with The City and all it has to offer. The Omni is ideally located, within walking distance to Union Square (great shopping), Belden Place (great dining) and the Cable Car stops right outside the front door of the hotel. We found the staff to be friendly, accommodating and quite professional, the hotel itself has the feel of a smaller boutique hotel and is an excellent choice for lodging. Definitely plan to stay here again in the near future.

Dec 8 2007 	Top San Francisco Hotel	Two nights on business. Second time at this excellent hotel. Consider this one of the best chain hotels I've stayed in and one of the best in Sand Francisco. All requests made during reservations are met by the Omni. On the way to airport left cell phone in limo and Lex Doherty, the excellent concierge, arranged for the phone to be sent by FED EX to my home the following morning. Hotel has added touches such as a creative way of giving you a semi-complimentary continental breakfast... coffee and juice are free... with minimal charges for extras. CB is delivered to your room with newspapers without all the formality of room service. They leave at door so you don't have to answer immediately early in the AM. Excellent location and very convient and friendly staff.

Dec 8 2007 	Beautiful Hotel A+	The hotel is beautiful and the location could not be more perfect! However it is the staff at the Omni that makes this hotel above the rest. Upon our arrival the front desk assisted my daughter and myself to plan tours, directions and transportation for our stay. Joey "suggested" not pushed on several choices based on our interests. As we were in the first few minutes of unpacking in our room, Joey sent complimentary refreshments via roomservice. The extra attention the entire staff including the housekeeping service was beyond our expectations. Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. Chinatown and Union Square are within walking distance. Other transportation we purchased the 3 day muni pass and rode the trolley and cable cars to every destination on our list. The suggested tours of Muir Woods and Napa Wine Country were awesome. Tower Tours picked us up from the hotel front door, they were well worth every cent. The tour guide named Will was outstanding. It is recommended 100%. We will certainly return to the Omni for our next visit to this fantastic city and would not even consider another hotel. Although we did not dine at Bob's, I regret not having done so. It will be on the list the next visit!

Dec 7 2007 	bland 	we had great expectations regarding our stay at this hotel after reading all the reviews on tripadvisor. We were also able to book 3 nights at a very good rate through omni's website. There was nothing wrong with this hotel except that it was exceptionally bland. It was comfortable (but so are courtyard hotels) & clean (as you would expect) but it had no zing.Not that we were looking for nightlife but, like much of america, it was so processed it was boring. The front desk staff where ok but lacked any connection with their guests (this is, I admit, very common in the states - "have a happy day"!)When we arrived to the room both my wife & I were glad that we had only paid $135USD not the usual $250-$400, as that was what it was worth.We had just come from the Signature MGM in Las Vegas which knocked us out!

Nov 28 2007 	Great Place Great Location!	This was the last leg of our Honeymoon (having already been to Vegas and Hawaii) and we were looking for a relaxed atmosphere and comfort and we struck gold again!...The hotel was lovely and clean, the staff friendly and the food excellent in the attached Bobs Steakhouse...hint - try the Massive onion rings..mmmmmm.... just in the right place for you to get to the embarcadero for the F-trams or walking, or turn right to tackle the big ole hills (well worth it!)...Cant fault the place at all!...a perfect end to a perfect honeymoon...S

Nov 21 2007 	Great Location Nice Hotel	I stayed at the Omni in San Francisco 11/10/07 for 1 night. I have been to San Francisco many, many times and this rates as one of the best hotels I've stayed at. They have a great location, the rooms were above average, and they have a restaurant that is definitely better than most hotel restaurants. (Bob's Chophouse)What prompted me to stay at this Omni for the first time in San Francisco was a free upgrade room pass I received for my horrible stay at the Omni in Austin, TX. I swore after that experience that I wouldn't stay again at an Omni, but wanted to use the upgrade and liked this location. Well, the upgrade (and what I was told I'd receive when I made the reservation) would have been an upgraded courtyard view. That didn't happen...we were given the inferior room anyway with an alley view so they didn't even utilize the upgrade or give us the room promised. If that hadn't occurred my experience would have been rated as "excellent".

Nov 20 2007 	Overall a great place to stay	We stayed at the Omni Hotel a family of 4 including 2 small children, for 2 nights. On arrival my children were given a backpacks with gifts from the hotel which they were delighted with, checkin was also very quick and staff friendly. Our room was a deluxe room it was very comfortable, classically decorated and very nicely finished. The lobby area of the hotel is also very grand with beautiful chandliers and staircase. The hotel is a very short walk from china town where we enjoyed a meal one night, the only downside to the hotel was the valet parking, A call had to be made to request your car 20 minutes prior, we did this 4 times during our stay and twice had to wait another 10 minutes also. Parking rates are expensive at 50 dollars a night.This aside the hotel and our room were lovely and all dealings we had with the staff , we found them to be helpful and friendly.

Nov 10 2007 	excellent	The staff and hotel were superb. Customer service from every staff member was amazing - recommendations for dining and attractions were right on - never too busy to help. The location of the hotel was terrific for walking to many of the prime tourist areas - safe and secure. Our room on the 5th floor was opulent.

Nov 8 2007 	Excellent service	This is an excellent quality hotel right in the heart of SF. The service from all staff was superb, location good, bar & restaurant great and so on!!This was just a quick one night stay before flying back to Europe. I was intrigued by the "most romantic hotel in SF" label when searching as we were at the end of our Honeymoon. Truth is it's a chain hotel that pretends not to seek out the corporate clients even though there were plenty of them. However, unlike so many other big name chains, the Omni seems to treat it's private guests very specially going that little step further for customer service. (Too often I find the chains trying to get the corporate money and just neglect those of us that want a nice hotel).Lots of nice little touches too numerous to mention here means I shall return here (and to any other Omni).And was it romantic? - Well this is not a boutique hotel - it's a large-ish city centre hotel. But given those constraints - surprisngly yes!

Nov 4 2007	Great Rooms Great Management OK Location (for us)	We stayed at the Omni based on reviews and overall pricing compared to other similarly rated large Hotels in San Francisco. We arrived quite late on a Thursday evening (9:30pm Pacific) due to our flight from Atlanta. We had booked online and I had asked for an upper level no-smoking room. There was no availability for either unfortunately I was told and initially we were placed in a smoking-permitted floor and room. I called the front-desk to ask if any accomodation could be made. The night manager, a wonderful person named Ellen K., indicated she would have us moved to another deluxe room that was non-smoking if we didn't mind moving to another room on our third day/night's stay. This was fine with us. Ellen subsequently called back a few minutes later and said the third night would be an upgraded deluxe suite room on an upper floor because of the trouble (at no extra charge of course). The entire stay was extremely nice, the BellHop area held an extra bag for us for three days while we went to Big Sur in a Miata and provided the bag as needed. Overall a great customer service environment. And the rooms/beds/furnishing was top-notch. The only possible knock is that the hotel is in the financial district. The night-life areas, such as Union Square and North Beach, are within a few blocks walking distance so this is a minor point-of-note. Don't wear heels like my wife did though.

Oct 25 2007 	Top Notch!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!	The hotel was top notch all the way. From express check in upon late evening arrival, to complimentary coffee, juice and paper delivered every morning to the room.The room was elegant and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic with wonderful toiletries.The workout room was private, just the right size and had complimentary water and fruit at all times.To top it all off, upon checkout they offered to take us via their Lincoln Town Car to our car rental agency in lieu of us taking a taxi.Would definetely stay here again!

Oct 24 2007	Horrible Experience with the Management	My stay at the Omni San Francisco started out poorly when I requested a double room (with two double beds) but received a queen room (with one queen). I asked for a rollaway bed, and ages later received a ridiculous inflatable bed not suitable for a comfortable nights sleep. I managed, but it was very uncomfortable. The worst part, however, came after my stay when I had a $300 charge on my credit card. I called to inquire about the charge and they proceeded to tell me it was for room damage. I had no idea what they were talking about and after further investigation, they told me there was a hole in the wall of the room we stayed in. I of course asked for the manager to call me, and was extremely taken aback at how I was treated. He was pompous and rude and immediately accused me of putting the hole in the wall. He assured me there was no way his staff would have missed the hole and rented out a room in such a state. I told him that they did, and that my friend (who I immediately phoned afterwards) actually saw the hole  but forgot to mention it to me (it was at the bottom of the wall near the baseboard in the hallway near the door, making it easy to miss). After I relayed this to the manager, he made a snide remark about how guests of his hotel are high-class and would call and complain if they received a room with a hole in the wall. Having no idea of the consequences of not reporting the hole, my friend didn't feel he needed to say anything and thus I never knew about it. The manager was horribly condescending and from his last remark implied that I was not a high-class guest and didnt belong at his hotel. I again assured him that the hole was not from me and he had no proof. He again insisted that his staff does not make mistakes and would never rent out a room with a hole in the wall. I was not going to budge and insisted that he reverse the charge. After going back and forth for awhile, he finally succumbed and reversed the charge. However, I was left with a bad taste in my mouth. I should not have had to defend my honor, and I knew he thought I was lying even after he reversed the charge. Even though I got the charge reversed, I still didnt feel like I won. This hotel should not be four-star, as four-star hotels would never treat their guests like this. The Omni San Francisco is a third-rate hotel with mediocre customer service and horrible management. Yes, it was bad luck that I got that room, but my experience with the management was enough to make me write this review and encourage travelers to stay somewhere else.

Oct 18 2007	Excellent Service	I have to say I am probably one of the most pickiest individuals with food and service. I will say the Omni surpassed my expectations. The rooms are nice enough (the beds, furniture, and TV) could be updated with more modern furnishings, but after that, the hotel is not only in a great location but their staff is extremely customer oriented and surpasses what you would get at any other hotel. I had one small problem with a smoker being in the room before me and the staff bent over backwards to get the problem corrected and comped a breakfast (with me asking) for the hassle. The check in was very easy and the food and drink in the bar was very good.I was very pleased and would stay there again.

Oct 18 2007 	Great staff great location	Location - - just a few blocks from Nob Hill (Cable Car Museum, Grace Cathedral and fabulous views), China Town and Union Square! The cable car stops at the corner just outside the hotel.The architecture in the Financial district is also gorgeous. That said, it is the Financial district and there is not much open on the weekend. (even Starbucks is closed on Sat and Sun!) You'll need to walk a few blocks for a coffee on the weekend.Staff - - The front desk staff is pleasant and very helpful. The door staff is fantastic. They give stellar directions, hail cabs in driving rain and even secured us a ride in an 'off duty' limo. Housekeeping is quick and thorough and very nice.

Oct 12 2007 	Terrific hotel in San Francisco	Omni is in the business district of San Francisco on California St. The room was very comfortable for 2, clean and quiet. Service was excellent. Bob's Chop House had breakfast that ran $25 but there is a Subway across the street. The restaurant seems to cater to the Business Lunch crowd. The concierge recommended a 3 day transit pass for $18. We walked out the door and literally stepped on a cable car. In other areas people were waiting 20 minutes to do the same.Concierge also recommended we take a city tour from Tower Tours . It too was excellentI'd stay there again.

Oct 8 2007 	Excellent hotel in quiet location	Hotel lived up to the Omni reputation from check in through to check out. Room was clean and standard high - toiletries were top notch!! Location is in the financial district so not too much on the doorstep but all within easy distance and trolley right outside the door. No panhandlers outside which for SF is a blessing!Restaurant looked good and is recommended in guides but we didn't eat there as it is very pricy. The bar was expensive too but cosy and relaxing.Staff were very helpful and you could even buy a MUNI pass (highly recommend for value and convenience) at the desk.We were celebrating our 10th anniversary and at check in I was given a red rose and in our room was complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Beautiful touch and greatly appreciated after a long flight.

Oct 1 2007 	Solid Four Star Property	Great location on California Street, centrally located to the financial district, Chinatown, and Union Square. It's right across the street from the Bank of America building, which helps you find the hotel if you're not familiar with San Francisco streets.Check in was very professional and courteous. I was able to secure an early check in at 10:00 am. It's a mid-sized property, compact, yet business smart and understated luxurious. Getting from your room to one of the conference rooms takes only a couple of minutes at most. Elevators are fast. Rooms are average sized, very comfortable, with nice bedding. Lighting is excellent for in-room working. Bathroom was upscale with granite counters, marble floor, large mirror, nice lighting, make up mirror, scale, and a roomy bathtub. Upscale bath amenities are provided. The banquet food was excellent and well-prepared. Did not try room service or restaurants. Express checkout made my departure smooth and quick.

Sep 30 2007 	Good value	Nice, clean rooms. Very efficient and friendly check-in and check-out. Excellent value. The steaks at Bob's downstairs are indeed terrific, and so are the views from the top floor of the Bank of America building opposite.

Sep 26 2007 	Four stars feels like five...	My husband and I stayed at the Omni for our first anniversary and loved it! The staff was SO nice from the moment we walked in the door. They were happy to help and full of information.The location is perfect. It's an easy walk to China Town and Little Italy. It's also about a 10 minute walk to Embarcadero shopping.The rooms were great. We had a small suite, and the toilettries were upscale products that I've only seen in Neiman Marcus. The rooms are very clean and the bed was really comfortable.The hotel restaurant is Bob's Steak and Chop House. There is no wireless internet available - in the room or in the lobby.I would absolutely recommend the Omni to anyone interested in a fairly luxurious hotel experience.

Sep 20 2007 	Faultless	After two weeks travelling we stayed for three nights here. Uniformly good service from staff. Rooms were welcoming & spacious without being too impersonal. Teenagers got cookies each night, we got an ice-bucket filled and chocolates.Good clean bathrooms. Interconnecting rooms a plus. Surprisingly quiet for central location. Walkable to main shopping & to China town restaurants. On cable car route. Don't bother with valet parking it is only one block to easy parking. Take a cable for the internet. Small but pleasant bar.

Sep 15 2007 	Excellent Hotel	My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Omni in San Francisco and we were so impressed with this hotel, we were compelled to write about it. The price is so affordable that you really don't expect to be 'wowed' by the hotel. But our expectations were far exceeded.The service of every staff member we came in contact with was exemplary. The Front Desk personnel were so helpful in recommending restaurants, transportation, etc. They even booked a (future) dinner for us at a restaurant in Napa Valley, which was the next leg of our vacation.The Front Desk personnel, Bellboys, the Doormen, the Housekeeping staff---every single person treated us like royalty. Our room was perfectly clean when we arrived, the front desk staff went out of their way to see that we had a room with a view, and they always followed up by phone to make sure we received whatever service we had requested. Additionally, the location of the Omni is ABSOLUTELY excellent. We walked EVERYWHERE. To the Ferry Building every day, to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, to Ghiaradelli Square, to Lombard Street, to dinner each night. We never had to take a taxi or other type of transportation. Granted, some of the walks were steep uphill climbs, but that was part of the inate charm of the city. What a fantastic, albeit short time we had in San Francisco. And many thanks to the Omni for making our stay so thoroughly enjoyable. Steve and Tammy Lunn, Laytonsville, Maryland

Sep 15 2007 	Great location	The hotel had a great location - we walked to North Beach, China Town, the Ferry building and shopping in downtown and felt safe in the area. They switched out their room service menus 1/2 way through our stay and the prices went from reasonable to pretty expensive. R/S was always on time and they were friendly.Our room was small with two double beds, one chair and a desk but it was well kept and housekeeping was very good. Our room was by an elevator on the 8th floor so I was a bit worried that it would be noisy but it was very quite. Service was good in the hotel but sometimes the door staff was a bit too casual.We ate one night in the bar off of the lobby and the food was good as was the service. We also ate at the Market Bar down by the Ferry building twice - once for lunch and once for brunch. It was great and had inside and outside seating available. The Ferry building also had some great gourmet food stores and retail shops. We had dinner at Home in the Lower Haight area and it was very good. It had simple food and a nice atmosphere.Overall the hotel was a great jumping off location to most points in the city and it was a hassle free stay in a safe location.

Sep 13 2007 	Perfect Service at the Omni	We stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 3 nights at the Labour Day weekend.It was the last stop of our honeymoon to the US and we couldn't have made a better choice.We were upgraded to a Bay View Room on the top floor (17th floor).My wife was given a rose at check in, they brought us a bottle of champaign and chocolate-coated strawberries and had arranged our bathrobes with another rose the first evening.Room service was simply outstanding.I highly recommend joining the free OMNI Select Guest programme which entitles you to complimentary WIFI, beverage and newsparer service.Staff was charming, attentive and helpful with the exception of one gruffy bellman.Dined once at Bob's Steakhouse (belonging to the hotel), waiters so so, but great food, had a perfect filet mignon.Cable Car line runs just in front of the house.The only minor drawbacks:- WIFI service doesn't work on the 17th floor which they "somehow forgot" to mention at check-in (however, as Select guest you can use the cable internet free of charge)- walls are quite thin (the same old story everywhere...)- parking: as usual in SF, street parking is a mess and the hotel charges a hefty 40$ valet fee for 24 hours + 6$ city tax.Hotel is within walking distance of Ferry Building, Embaracadero, Coit Tower, Market Street, Chinatown and SOMA.Would highly recommend and always return there.

Sep 11 2007 	Travel Agent's review	My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 4 nights at the Omni, and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel.Arrival - we opted for public transportation, taking the BART from SFO airport to Montgomery st and walked up the street to the hotel (maybe a 10 minute walk) It cost us $5.15 per person rather than $42 for a taxi from the airport, and it took about 40 minutes.Check in/out - I had notified the hotel that we would be arriving early (10am) and we received our room right away. We were also permitted to check out late, at 1pm.Staff - were fantastic, very friendly and helpful. I had notified the hotel that it was my husband's birthday, and they sent up a bottle of wine (which was pretty good), a fruit and cheese platter and a birthday card. We had nightly turndown service and were given a weather report for the next day, and chocolates.Room - beautifully decorated room, comfortable king size bed, nice ammenities in the bathroom. There was a desk and an armchair with an ottoman - perfect for relaxing and putting your feet up after a long day of walking!Location - in the financial district, but within walking distance to all the sights (if you like to walk!) The hotel is very close to North Beach (Little Italy) and China town, where we enjoyed a few meals. The ferry building/market was a short 10 minute walk, and pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf were about a 25-30 minute walk away. We walked everywehre, and never found anywhere too far or more of a 1/2 hour walk. Concierge gave us maps and directions to all the places that we wanted to visit. There were also a few good nightclubs and pubs just around the corner from us.* Sign up for the free Signature guest program - you get juice and a paper every morning and nightly turndown service with a chocolate!Sights / recommendations* Alcatraz - we did the night tour (booked in advance), it was cool, and kinda spooky to be there at night.* Pier 39 - the sealions were one of our highlights, you could watch them play / fight for hours! We ate at Bubba Gump's (just for the novelty of it) but the food was lousy and overpriced.* Fisherman's Wharf - nice to walk around, lots of souvenir shops and fresh seafood stands.* Giradelli Square - go for the sundaes, they are worth the $8!* Lombard St - worth the walk up this hill / crooked street* Tonga Room - just up the street (hill) from the hotel (at the Fairmont Hotel) we went for the $8 happy hour buffet, well worth a visit for an early dinner, and the atmosphere is pretty cool, especially when it "rains."* AT & T park - saw a Giants game (bought tickets there), what a nice park, with beautiful views of the bay (if you get the right seats - we were on club level)* Ferry Building / Market - there was always some kind of street performance going on there.We'd definately return to the Omni!

Sep 11 2007 	Excellent Stay	Stayed here with my husband for one night as an anniversary weekend getaway. The hotel was clean and the lobby is gorgeous. Reminded me of the Titanic movie with its 1920's decor. The rooms are spacious...a bit old, but very clean. The front desk was friendly and the hotel really does go out of its way to make you feel welcomed. Upon check in, my husband I were greeted with a rose for me and congrats on our wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to the 17th floor and given a room with a view of the bay. Nice! Then hotel sent a martini glass full of chocolate truffles and a small bottle of red wine with a card that wished us happy anniversary. Totally cute and a pleasant surprise.The hotel is defintely worth its value.

Sep 10 2007	Omni is heaven	The Omni was great! The room was clean, comfortable and the service at the hotel was second to none. We loved the coffee/juice and paper deliverey to the room each morning. The evening turn down service was perfect at the end of a long day! I very much recommend the Omni and we will definitely stay there again.

Sep 10 2007 	Beautiful hotel	I booked the Omni based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the Hotel was even more amazing than all of the reviews would have you believe. The rooms are beautiful, the staff is friendly, attentive and helpful and the room service was fantastic. It's also extremely convenient to the cable car and Chinatown. I would definitely return to the Omni San Fran.

Sep 5 2007	Downtown Hotel But with a little more soul than most	This could be just a standard downtown hotel, but it's better than average. The staff is friendly, the housekeeping staff leaves you cute notes, they gave us a rose because we were celebrating our wedding anniversary...The location is very central. The cable cars stop outside and it's only five blocks to the Ferry Terminal Building.It exceeded my expectations.

Sep 4 2007 	The Omni is fantastic	What a great stay. We had signed up for the Select Guest membership and received complimentary beverages in the morning and evening turndown service. We got to check in early - like 9 am - and were always given great directions and advice for siteseeing. Our room was in great condition - really clean. The location was great too, as it was within walking distance of transportation, shopping, dining, etc. I would definitely stay here again!

Sep 3 2007 	Perfect Omni Weekend Getaway	I love staying in wonderful hotels, so when my boyfriend and I chose to escape the Los Angeles heatwave and enjoy a romantic getaway in San Francisco, The Omni was the perfect choice. We drove and arrived at 3:00 am and were greeted even in the wee hours with a perfect check in and a smile. Our room was on the 16th floor and had great architectural views of nearby buildings. The room was elegant and cozy with top notch Molton Brown bath products. The hotel location is close to everything and you can walk to all points of interest such as Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, SFMOMA, Yuerba Buena Gardens, etc. Weather was perfect, concierge made dinner reservations to the Carnelian Room for us on the 52nd Floor of the B of A Building which has spectacular views of SF. It was perfect. We took a trolley from the wharf back to the hotel and were dropped off right in front of the Omni. It doesn't get much better than that!

Sep 1 2007 	Great hotel and location.	This hotel is in a great location, on a cable car line, near to china town and opposite a great restaurant in the bank of america builing. Our room was of good quality fixtures and fittings, staff were very helpful, with a nice bar area looking onto the street.Hotel is about a 10 minute waalk to union square for shopping, 15 minute walk to the nearest pier area and bay bridge.Fishermans wharf is a cab or bus ride. Book alcatraz prison tour before you arrive in san fran. Open top otur bus of city worth doing as well.No free parking at hotel, have to use car parks opposite, which are not cheap.

Aug 24 2007 	Elegant hotel and amazing steak restaurant!	We stopped here for three nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel looks very elegant and the front desk staff are extremely welcoming. They are very happy to offer you advice about 'the sights' and will make every effort to make you feel a valued customer. The price, which is not excessive, was justified in the quality. I'd told them that it was our honeymoon when I booked the room. When we arrived we had been upgraded to a beautiful room on the 16th (out of 17) floor. When we got to the room we were greeted with huge strawberries dipped in dark chocolate, chilled sparkling wine, red wine, fresh fruit, mineral water all dressed with orchid heads and a hand written note congratulating us. It was really wonderful.The room was a very good size, bathroom fantastic - Molton Brown products. Bed was extremely comfortable with very good quality linen. The whole hotel was very clean and the housekeeping staff clearly took pride in their work. There was even a note welcoming us to the hotel from the member of staff responsible for our room- very nice touch.We had breakfast and dinner in Bob's Steakhouse. The breakfast was nice but nothing outstanding. Service on both occasions was good. The steak however was simply the best either of us have ever tasted! We both had the fillet mignon, it was cooked perfectly to our request. Fabulous.I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will happily book hotels within this chain again.

Aug 21 2007 	Excellent Stay	The Omni San Francisco really was absolutely wonderful. Aug 20 2007 	Easy walk to various sites: Union Square by muni cable car BART	After reading the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor, we used HotWire for our one night at the Omni, at a reasonable rate. Later, (most likely) our concierge also surprised us with a small bottle of wine, along with more chocolates, probably delivered during turndown service.I had also signed up for Omni's free Select Membership benefits online: i.e.complimentary morning newspaper - notify Front Desk which one, complimentary morning beverages - write on Breakfast menu tag and hang outside door before going to sleep, late check out - after 12 noon but notify Front Desk, evening turndown service, etc.We parked at St. Mary's Garage (entrance on left-side, 1/2 block before California, while driving north on Kearny). $32 for 24 hrs. Jul 26 2007 	Flawless	Booked a room using Priceline and was lucky enough to get the Omni San Francisco. The hotel pays attention to every detail, and I mean EVERY detail. Jul 15 2007 	Consistent Quality at the Omni	Stayed here July 6-8. May 31 2007 	Great choice if you can get a great rate otherwise maybe not	Found a great deal for Memorial Day weekend....spent five nights here for $139/night (plus taxes).At this rate it was great and well worth my money, otherwise I don't think I'd come here again when rates reach $350+Lobby is fantastic, but as other reviews say, the glamour stops here. May 31 2007 	Another great stay at the Omni!!!!!!	This was our fourth stay at the Omni and again was not disappointed. We loved the cozy feeling of the Omni---smaller hotel, quiet area on the weekend and not bad during the week, a cable car right out front, North Beach a short walk away, the compimentary beverages in the morning, the hot apple cider in the evenings and the fact that we saw the same staff everyday during our stay. They got to know us and were very helpful and attentive to our travel plans. Not so at the SF Marriot! The Deluxe room was well appointed but not luxurious. The bathroom was well light and had a make-up mirror as well (something my girlfriend wanted to point out). May 30 2007 	A great hotel provided you get it at the right price. We walked to the theatre, some great restaurants in North Beach, and shopping. Cab rides were readily available to anywhere else.I'd definitely pay extra for a Signature rooms on the 16th floor, as the little touches, like a high thread-count sheets, are definitely worth it. At that price, this place is an incredible bargain, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for business or pleasure.

May 14 2007 	Beautiful 	I loved the Omni Hotel. My boyfirend and I decided to vacation in our own city and treat ourselves to a luxury hotel for a couple nights. The Omni was fabulous. May 7 2007 	Great Hotel	Picked Omni from previous reviews... Some may say being on edge of financial district is quiet, well No! We experienced a Thursday, Friday and Saturday. It is only 10 min walk from Ferry Building which has many cafes etc and markets at the weekend. Busiest route is from the Market to Fishermansd Wharf via Hyde Street. This one passes over Lombard Street just by the 'crooked street' bit. Great fun standing on the side and leaning out.... which you are not supposed to do of course. We did have one evening meal in the Bob's Steakhouse, attached to hotel and one brealfast. Very good quality although a bit more expensive. Mar 10 2007 	Dont be put off by it not being on Market St or in Union Square	A lot of reviews of this fabulous hotel say its in a quiet part of town (financial district) and coming from London you imagine this means that you'll need a taxi to get anwhere and the area will be quite eerie.WRONG.If you have a pair of legs and can walk you can be on Market St/Union Square in 5-10 minutes.I'm used to big busy cities and there is nothing worse than staying in the throbbing throng with all the tourists. For this reason the location of the Omni is a real bonus. Far from the madding crowd but no so far to be any kind of inconvenience.It is true that most of the guests seem to be there on business but its no problem. Dont eat there if you dont want to hear suits talk turkey. Go out and enjoy the many fanatsic restaurants in San Fran instead.TIPS:Join the SelectGuest programme (a kind of clubcard membership) for free in adavnce and then you get a free paper and drink delivered to your room every morning at a time you specify. You also get the option of ordering light breakfast items at an extremely reasonbale rate. (cream cheese toatsted bage was about $3 or 1.50).The gym is stocked with complimentary water and fresh(ish) fruit. 'Nuff said on that one!Free internet service in the lobby.If noise bothers you stay as high up as possible. (on the 5th you can hear the tram bells, on the 13th you can hear nothing).You can buy your MUNI passes from the fornt desk at their face value.If travelling without too much luggage do yourself a favour at SFO and use the BART rather than pay for a taxi. A jounrey on the BART is only $5.15 and the walk from Montgomery Station is less than 10 minutes. The BART was very safe and clean.ROOMS:Look nicer than they appear in the photos. They're quite dark which is why the photos dont do them justice. It's all very faux-Georgian but tastefully done. Bathrooms are classy too.Not enormous amounts of storage but enough. Avoid the mini-bar.SERVICE:Front-desk and doormen were superb. Extremely friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble.Room service was extremely punctual with the selectguest drinks delivery. (you book a 15 minute slot and they there on the button every time).A Maitre D at Bobs steakhouse (attached to the Omni) was a bit stuffy but thats not their problem. Remember its mainly business people eating or using the bar there so I would avoid.LOCATION:You're in the business district but this does mean the area is well served by espresso bars, jamba juice and diners for workers. Also, a tram stops outide the hotel which is handy.You can walk most places very easily or use your MUNI pass for the transport.

Mar 8 2007	Perfect location for Family vist to Chinese New Year	We were thoroughly pleased with our stay at the Omni. We had adjoining rooms (a King and a double) and were assistd at every turn by Omnii staff. We have stayed in more than a dozen hotels in S.F. (St. Francis, the Palace, the Milano, Hyatts, Mariott, Sir Francis Drake, Kensington Park etc.) over the years and this was definately among the best. Many hotels will have nice lobbies, but have very ordinary rooms . The Omni had beautifully furnished luxurious rooms with every imaginable amenitiy. I would recommend it to anyone. As San Francisco is developing more and more to the east of Union Square, restaurants, shopping and attractions are near the Financial District location of the Omni. Plus, the California Cable Car line is right outside. We were in S.F. for the Chinese New Year Parade (a block away), Prom Dress Shopping, (5 min walk) and to attend an event at MoMA (10 minute walk). Nearby Belden Place offers some of San Franciscos best restaurants and a truly european bistro experience, that is entirely family friendly. We had dinner at Brindisi. Make reservations for weekends at any S.F. restaurant.. The hotel valet parking is $45 , high even for San Francisco. However, around the corner on Kearny is a 24 hour city parking lot with security. A bargain. If you join the Omni's "club" before your stay, you also get real pampering including morning coffee delivered to your door with the paper and free internet. We loved it!

Mar 5 2007 	Great Service Great Hotel Great Stay!	We booked the Omni based on two factors: price for 2 rooms as given through Expedia and also reviews from Trip Advisor. This was a getaway weekend for me, 2 adult sisters, and our Mom to celebrate Mom's birthday.BACKGROUND: Each member of our gang is a very seasoned world traveler, and we have stayed in every type of accommodation around the world from the St. Regis and Four Seasons to camping in a tent on Kuaui, with many a "hostel experience" thrown in for good measure. We are also all veteran San Francisco travelers, with one sister having lived in the city at one time. We have stayed all over the city in all types of properties (large and small, cheap and luxury) and we ALL AGREE: The Omni gets our unanimous vote as our new San Francisco "home away from home"!!! From check in to check out, everything was smooth and wonderful and the staff, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff, could not have been nicer or more accommodating.FRONT DESK: We checked in on Friday and arrived quite early (10.30 a.m.) expecting to have to store our luggage until later in the day. Surprise! Two rooms were ready and waiting. However, upon getting up to the rooms, we discovered that we had one room with 2 doubles and one with 1 king. We wanted to have two rooms, both with doubles, connecting if possible. One call to the front desk, a thorough search of the computer, and VOILA: just what we wanted. Not only that, but the bellman brought up the keys to the new rooms so we did not even have to go downstairs again.The bellman made sure to get all of our luggage sorted out, gave us a run-down on the hotel's services, put himself at our complete disposal, and was just a friendly as he could be. It is clearly obvious that whomever is providing the customer service training for the staff is to be highly commended: not ONCE did we ever receive anything less that a gracious smile, a hello, and an offer to assist. We also requested a VERY late check out (3 p.m.) and were accommodated without a hitch.AMENITIES: the hotel has a great fitness center with lots of cardio options, headphones for the plasma screen individual TV units, and free bottled water. Also has reciprocity for the full scale fitness club located across the street.Guest rooms have blow dryers, good lighting in the bathroom and elsewhere in the room, full tub with shower, nice toiletries, robes, and an in-room safe. Lighted closet with lots of hangers, and minibar too. There is FREE high-speed interenet access in the room (hard wired) as well as a business center that offers free internet if you did not bring your own laptop. They will also print free pages for you if needed.....Also: the WINDOWS in the rooms open to allow for fresh air ventilation! We love this! The heating / ac unit if very quiet and powerful too. With the windows open there is some street noise (even at higher levels) but we didn't mind.BEDS: comfy, comfy, firm and soft at the same time, duvet comforters, with great pillow choice. Pillows are an issue with me & I usually travel everywhere with my own to avoid vacation-ruining neck pain, but I left mine behind in the interest of packing light. I was not disappointed!THE AREA: The location of the hotel is downtown near the financial center, near the end of the California cable car line and the Montgomery Street BART station. It is very convenient if you are doing business in the area during the week, and much quieter if you stay on the weeknd as we did. Many of the close-by cafes and coffee shops close over the weekend. However, there are PLENTY within easy walking distance (within 10 block radius) that are open all weekend. You can walk to Union Square in one direction and the Ferry Plaza Marketplace in the other direction and be in either location within 10 minutes. Also: this is a SAFE walk and you will not pass by too many homeless (a problem in any large city, sadly).TRANSPORTATION: If you are uncomfortable or unable to walk, the hotel has Guest Cars (town cars) that will happily take you anywhere in the city you would like to go (or back to the airport when you leave, crying). The doorman will let you know the cost BEFORE you get in the car, and the price is comprable to taking a cab, and much cleaner. The front desk staff can direct you to and make reservations for you at any of the terrific SF restaurants. EATING: This is a city that runs on it's stomach. For morning (or afternoon) lattes & cappucino, we would recommend a stroll through North Beach with a stop at "CAFFE PUCCINI" near the corner of Columbus & Vallejo (next to Tratoria Pinnochio). Also, "MOLINARI'S ITALIAN DELI" (on Columbus) for sandwiches & the Salami. They make their own & are famous for it. For dinner & lunch, we would happily recommend "BOULEVARD" (great location, fantastic food & service, very pricey) as well as "YANK SING" (dim sum, extended lunch hours only, including weekends, great food, traditional cart serving, moderately pricey depending on your appetite, delicious).In addition, if you go over the weekend, you MUST go to the Saturday Morning Farmer's Market at the Ferry Plaza. This is not to be missed, and go hungry, as you will be able to eat everything from pastries to tamales, with coffee bars, cheese, fruits & veggies. Definitely worth a stop an a beautiful weekend to get your picnic fixins on your way out to Angel Island, Alcatraz, or the Marina District or Golden Gate Park.Whew! Thanks for reading through to the end. I hope that if you stay at the Omni, you will be as pleased as we were. Have FUN!

Feb 18 2007	Heart of San Francisco	Our family of 3 adults stayed at the Omni for a long weekend last summer. The room was a good size for us with great amenities. As noted by other reviewers, the staff was very helpful. If returning to San Francisco, we would stay again.

Jan 19 2007 	Great Time at Omni in San Francisco	My husband and I stayed at the Omni in San Fran on 12/25 and 12/31 (spent time in wine country in between), and we had a lovely time. Jan 7 2007 	Omni style and service!	We spent two nights at the Omni after Christmas. Having stayed at the Omni San Diego, I was curious to see if the San Francisco hotel was deserving of its #1 rating by TripAdvisor reviewers. I booked directly through the Omni website and the $199 Park and Play offer included parking and a superior room. Having paid approximately $48 a night for parking at a hotel in the Union Square area, this seemed a great deal. As a Select Guest, registration info is on file and so you basically walk up to the desk and receive your room card. I had requested and received a front-facing (California St) room on a high floor. The lobby area was beautifully decorated and complimentary hot cider and cookies were available. The bed was extremely comfortable, as was the large armchair with ottoman. The room is tastefully decorated with a large work desk, many lamps, Bose radio and armoire with television/coffee service/mini-bar and large drawers for clothing. The large closet has a safe and bathrobes. The bathroom was large with a huge shower/tub with great water pressure. Large make-up mirror, too. As mentioned, Select Guest program will get you beverages and a newspaper, delivered at the time you designate. Some breakfast items offered to SGs at $2-4 such as bagels, muffins or breakfast burrito. Great prices! More extensive menu available through room service. This is one of the few hotels that delivers a large carafe of coffee if that is your selected beverage. Bagels come toasted, wrapped in a cloth napkin and with cream cheese and an assortment of fruit preserves. The steakhouse restaurant has very good food- a variety of soups, salads and sandwiches were on lunch menu. Prices a bit high but not out of line for SF restaurants. Staff very attentive. Hotel very quiet but the city, and Financial District in particular, have a low occupancy rate during the holiday period. This hotel is an excellent choice for business travellers.

Jan 3 2007 	The Omni Gets It Right	My 3-day New Year's getaway at the Omni SF reconfirmed my committment to this luxury hotel chain. I booked a 2-night stay via Expedia at an incredible rate, about $120 per night. I normally opt for affordablility over luxury, but sometimes you just want to be pampered and are willing to pay a little bit more. For those occasions, you can't go wrong with Omni. They understand the what a true luxury hotel experience is all about. At Omni, the customer is always right, and the customer's needs always come first. Case in point- my room key did not work upon check-in (they had given me a room that was still occupied, oops), and when I returned to the front desk, they upgraded me to a 2-room corner suite for my trouble, apologizing all the while. This was followed up with a personal note of apology from the front desk manager the next morning - and a fresh fruit basket in the afternoon, again gratis. The suite (room 920) was gorgeous, with a sitting room, 2 flat-screen TVs, and a DVD player. One of the nice things about staying in the Financial District is that it's very quiet at night - no sirens, ambulances, etc.I joined the Select Guest program several years ago. As others have noted, I highly recommended joining for the free perks. I enjoyed the complimentary beverages (choice of 2 - try the coffee and hot chocolate together!) and morning paper, and was pleasantly suprised to find that this Omni also offered Select Guests a range of reduced-price breakfast items along with the complimentary morning beverages. For $3.75 each, we ordered the breakfast burritos, which were hefty and delicious, served with fresh salsa. Imagine - a delicious room-service breakfast in SF for under $5! I stll can't quite understand how this place made money off my stay....I guess it all averages out in their favor. Stay here, you'll be glad you did.

Oct 14 2009	So much to see in San Francisco	We just returned from a 4 day weekend in San Francisco and I don't know where to begin. The Prescott Hotel was decent. The staff is definitely helpful but the room is small. Coffee and tea are served from 6 am until 9:30 am and wine is served from 5-6 in the hotel lobby. The location is great - a block to all the great shopping that Union Square offers. Great sushi restaurants, cafes, bars and restaurants can be found in the blocks surrounding the hotel. We took a tour of Sonoma and Muir Woods with Extranomical Tours on Friday. You will only spend an hour in Muir Woods but according to my sister - If you have seen one redwood you have seen them all. The tour stops at three wineries and a cafe for lunch. In order to pack in all the wineries you only stay for about 45 minutes at each winery. You have enough time for tastings, photos and a quick walk around the grounds. The wineries do not provide a tour of the grounds nor do you see anything about how the wine is made. It' great if you are only there for a few days like we were and are trying to fit everything in. We hit all the tourist spots - the Cannery, Ghiradelli Square, the Wharf, a streetcar, a cablecar, the Haight and Alamo Square. I recommend the $11 one day all you can ride pass or the $18 three day pass for public transportation. Two cablecar and one bus ride and the pass will pay for itself.

When we arrived after a long flight we were greated with smiles from the reception staff and were very helpful in explaining everything. The room was clean and tidy. The resteraunt staff were helpful, chaty and the food was excellent. The location of the hotel is near to the shops and other areas of interest. Only one fault outside my window there were fans blowing all night and day it sounded like you were constantly in an plane.

Oct 7 2009 	Thoroughly enjoyable 5 night stay in Downtown SF.	Stayed 5 nights in early September. Great location, only 5 mins walk to Union Sq. & 10 mins gentle downhill to Market/Powell station. We took the BART train from the airport (recommend this) & had a 15min walk up Powell & along Post to hotel. No problem. Relax when you see the Donnatello Hotel! Staff were very helpful & attentive, particularly front desk & internet engineer. He arrived at our room after only 8 mins & sorted our internet access problem staight away. More than adequate Continental breakfast spread with lots of fresh fruit. Sets you up for the day. It's worthwhile going Club class for the Happy 'Hour'. Great way to unwind after a day sightseeing. Meant to be 4.30-6pm but fortunately tended to overrun as we usually arrived about 5.30 after a full day in the city. Hints to leave were very subtle. Met some really nice folk from all over the world, picked up a few tips about other places we were going to visit. Our room was a bit small but very comfortable. Spent 3 nights in another cheaper hotel nearby later on & appreciated the difference. We would DEFINITELY go back to the Prescott..

Oct 6 2009 	Great Location 	I had a comfortable 3 night stay. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The location is one block from Union Square and a main trolley line. Easy walking distance to China Town, Convention Center, etc. The room was comfortable and clean, but small. Overall the place is a bit worn and needs a refresh. Worn out carpet, stained bath curtain, tiny pillows, 19" TV, no in-room coffee - all things that could be updated. I had dinner a couple of times and found the found to be good (not great, but good). My other issue is noise - I was on the second floor overlooking Post, and the street noise was horrible. I should have changed rooms, but...never got around to it. Overall, I'd stay here again if the price was right.

Oct 5 2009 	Highly satisfactory	This was a good value hotel with great staff, good rooms and a brilliant location. I think it was everything you'd want for your money and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco. Great location near Union Square and a stones throw away from good bars and shops. It really was a good base from which to go anywhere on foot or by public transport. Very friendly staff and a good clean, relatively spacious room. I think it lived up to expectations and represented good value for money. We had a very pleasant stay here.

Sep 30 2009 	Lovely boutique hotel w great service!	My boyfriend & I stayed at the Prescott for 5 nights in September. Throughout, the most amazing thing was the service: We had a minor problem with the cold water, and called down to the desk. It was fixed in literally 15 minutes. The concierge printed our return boarding passes for us in 2 min. with no charge (the Nikko 4 yrs ago wanted $12). Throughout, the staff was very pleasant and attentive to our needs. And more....The room was not huge but big enough. It was nicely appointed and cozy and clearly recently redecorated. The bathroom was lovely. All in all, an excellent hotel. Only two cautions: since this is a small & only 7-story hotel, there is no "view"--just the buildings across the street. I did miss that. Also, for the elderly or infirm--there is absolutely NOTHING to hold onto when in the shower, and the tub floor was a bit slippery. But other than that--A+++++!!!

Sep 29 2009 	Not bad	The hotel is at a good location, it looks very old, but very clean, the rooms are very small but clean, the toilets are very clean and well maintained. The response is prompt, professional and polite. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The food is good , but the options of complimentary breakfast is few.The hotel needs to modernize, and revamp the rooms, and maintain the service standards

Sep 23 2009 	Very satisfied with club level at the Prescott	Two couples spent 3 nights at the club level rooms at the Prescott. We were in 422 and 426, both Queen rooms overlooking Post St and steps from the club room/wine reception. The rooms were fine, enough room, medium sized baths with shower tub combos. Windows open for those who like to look out on the street and get a bit of a breeze. We had flat screen tv in an armoire. One room had a faulty remote/tv which was replaced the next day after informing the front desk. The rooms were clean and had standard mini bar, iron, robes.We used the club room twice for the evening reception 4:30 to 6:30 pm. We had wine, champagne, and cocktails along with 3 cheese choices, pizzas from Postrio, and bread. Food was good and replendished often.Our Kimpton air/hotel rate included breakfast downstairs in part of Postrio. One side of the room had the cereal, pastries, bagels, juice, coffee, etc. Be sure to check the other side of the breakfast room for the eggs, potatoes, bacon, etc...it wasn't obvious that these were available.There were cookies on a plate at the front desk in the afternoon when we stopped in after touring all day.We received the New York Times daily at our door and on Sunday morning the SF Chronical was available in the Postrio breakfast room. We were very satisfied with the entire experience.

Sep 4 2009 	Great location very helpful staff and a good hotel	This hotel is right in the downtown area of SF close by Union Square. Sep 2 2009 	Great value for money execellent location	The location of this hotel was very covenient. Aug 31 2009 	Great for the price but disappointment for a Kimpton	I've stayed in several Kimpton properties, and this one has been the most disappointing. Let me preface my thoughts first: I got upgraded to a King Suite and only paid $150/night, which is a deal in SF and I would have been prepared for $300+ for a Kimpton.Let's start with the positives, considering the great rate I paid:- large room- very comfy bed- very central location- quiet room- stayed on the Club Level, and the bartender and food at the cocktail reception were very attentive and tasty, respectively- typical Kimpton, as-in a old hotel that's been modernized yet maintains some old-hotel charmsThe things that disappoint me about this Kimpton, compared to the others:- what happened to the turn-down service?- rooms have noticeable wear-and-tear -- including the scary white-ish spots on the sofa- mini bar is simply a cheap fridge where the bottles are tossed in and no organization- a/c was sporadic. The other couple in our party complained theirs never worked well (which concurs with other reviews posted recently)- half the windows will close, but not lock. Two were open when I arrived, so we had a couple flies that had to die an untimely death via NYTimes-smashing- the Club-Level "free" breakfast was basic. Cereal, pastries, coffee and fruit. Any proteins or hot items must be purchased at typical big-city prices.Long of the short, I'd probably stay here again if I could get the same rate. However, if there are no upgrades/refurbishments and rate is $200+, I'd probably give another hotel a chance first.PS. Want free wifi? Simply joint Kimpton's rewards program. It's free, and they don't pester you with emails. Fair trade, in my opinion.

Aug 21 2009 	Good location small room broken air conditioning poor service	Our room was in the "anex", meaning we had to take the elevator to the 4th floor, get off, go down the hall, around the lounge, get on another elevator and go up to the 7th floor. The service man said it was on time delay and left. 30 minutes later (and now 80 degrees) we called again. This time he drained a pipe in the ceiling and the air came back on. Same thing 2 days later, and no air again the morning we checked out! So, on a 4 night stay we had no air 3 times. SF was having a bit of a heat wave during our visit, so no air was not an option! We won't stay here again.

Aug 10 2009 	Relaxing 5 day saty	Room was clean. Front desk very helpful. We had a suite so we had a lot of room. The only down sides were that they ran out food at the breakfast one morning. Also, we left our room one day at 8am and came back at 2:30 and the cleaning lady arrived at the door to clean the room just as we got back.We had a summer special so the rates were great.The wine hour was very enjoyable and we were able to meet new people. We had a newspaper by our door every morning. We paid for the package deal which included breakfast and it was well worth it. They offered a great spread for breakfast.We were there for a wedding nearby so we stayed 5 nights and we were very comfortable. The room was away from the elevators & was very quiet.The location was terrific. Only a block from Union Square.We had dinner in their restaurant one night and the food and service was very good.Kimptons are known to be small hotels so don't stay there if you are looking for something large.We would stay here again.

Aug 10 2009 	Decent but not the best of Kimpton.	I was excited because we got a 20th Anniversary package at the Kimpton website that included a club level suite with breakfast and a $50 voucher for Postrio, Wolfgang Puck's restaurant in the lobby. The club level came with a 2 hour cocktail reception instead of the standard Kimpton wine reception but was just kind of chaotic, not as well managed as the wine receptions usually are. There was a decent selection of alcohol but too many people for the 1 bartender/attendant. Aug 3 2009 	Terrible Tired and Smelly	We had a terrible experience at the Prescott -- and we didn't even stay there! It was so bad that we checked out before we checked in. When we arrived, we were told it would be approx. an hour before the room was ready. When they showed us to the room, it was so smelly and stunk so badly that the bellman called the front desk immediately and asked for another room. We went back to the Club Lounge to catch up on some work and wait for another room. We were told it would take approximately an hour. Four hours later, we were still sitting there. No one had come to check on us, offer us water or snacks, or update us on the status of the room. Jun 11 2009 	Great hotel awesome location and charming staff	Well, after reading the other reviews I was really worried about booking, however, booked it on TZOO, for $99.oo nad then upgraded to club level for another 30, well, I must say we got a steal, the club level had an open bar including my favorite California "Champagne" and an awesome cheese "bar" and served hot pizza and it included each morning a bountiful continental breakfast. The location was awesome. In the heart of the financial district, blocks away from far more than we could ever dream of doing. May 22 2009 	not a 4 star but nice	This hotel would really be a 3 star not a 4. I've noticed if you are shopping around for hotels in San Francisco, whatever the rating states, go 1 star lower. May 18 2009 	Pretty average overall-could be better could be worse...	My husband and I just stayed at the The Prescott last month for two nights. The location was the best part, being right around the corner from Union Square. When we checked in and went to our room, we couldn't leave when we wanted because our in room safe wouldn't work. We had to wait for someone to re-program it, but apparently this happens everytime someone checks in because someone's kid once locked the keys in the safe! Would be nice if they would take care of this before making us figure it out and have to wait for them to fix it. The hotel itself is older and in okay condition, the room was fine except the picture in the bathroom was filthy and looked like no one had cleaned it in years-pretty gross. One nice thing was that high speed internet was included in the room rate, which is not always the case with SF hotels. We upgraded to the club-level for $1 more and the evening cocktail reception was included. On Sunday night there were so many people there and only one poor guy serving drinks AND appetizers to everyone-pretty ridiculous. When we arrived, the cheese plate with bread was decimated-nothing left and apparently when its gone...its gone. Monday night was less busy and there were two people serving. Breakfast was a typical buffet continental breakfast, but it was hell to try to get some boiling water to make a real cup of tea. They were concerned I'd burn myself! I even told them they could just pour the boiling water into my cup with the teabag and then give it to me, but they just didn't get it. Overall, our stay could have been much better, but then again, it could have been much worse-so I guess this is better than the latter.

May 11 2009 	Great Location But Dated	Have stayed at the Prescott on several occasions while on business in SF. Staff is great and very friendly. The rooms are a bit dated now. Most are in need of refurbish and do not meet the standards of a true 4-star as listed. On the plus side, most of the rooms are very large for a city hotel. Even though a bit tarnished, the rooms are always spotless and in good order. Lots of unusual hallways similar to other old hotels. They have a great wine tasting in the lobby daily and the Club Level is very nice. I'm not usally into that stuff but found myself a couple of times having a glass and meeting some other travelers. Most are from Europe and Latin America. Very interesting.In-room amenities are great. Sucker for a mini-bar and has a great one. Wireless and wired internet with good functional desk and chair. Lots of windows though usually your view is of other rooms, but natural light.They have an attached restuarant. Only had breakfast that was very good and reasonably priced for hotel ($17). Parking is terrible - but its that way anywhere in SF. $45-night and you must valet.The location is great. Just off Union Square and walkable to just about anywhere. We walked over to North Beach to eat Italian. It was especially great after dinner walking off that great meal at North Beach Italian (must try). You go right through China town. If you pick the right streets, you miss any big hills.Summary - if you get it cheap, a great hotel find. Not a true 4-star anymore, but would recommend for all the little things.
